[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_secret_key_share.rs] [Macro: dealt_secret_key_share_impl] [Import hygiene] The macro uses imports from the parent module - can macro hygiene issues cause the wrong types to be imported when the macro is expanded in different contexts? (Medium)

(High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_secret_key_share.rs] [Function: new()] [Unvalidated input] The new() constructor accepts any DealtSecretKey without validation - can a malicious player construct shares that pass individual checks but fail when combined during threshold reconstruction? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_secret_key_share.rs] [Struct: DealtSecretKeyShare] [Missing player binding] The share doesn't store which player it belongs to - can shares be reassigned to different players during DKG, breaking the threshold security assumptions? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_secret_key_share.rs] [Function: to_bytes()] [Serialization context leak] When shares are serialized for storage or transmission, is there any contextual information (player ID, transcript ID) included that could be manipulated to use shares in wrong contexts? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_secret_key_share.rs] [Trait: ValidCryptoMaterial] [Missing versioning] The ValidCryptoMaterial implementation doesn't include version information - can old shares be replayed in new DKG rounds with different security parameters? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_secret_key_share.rs] [Struct: DealtSecretKeyShare] [Threshold bypass] Can an attacker collect fewer than threshold shares and still reconstruct partial information about the secret by exploiting the linear structure of Shamir secret sharing? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_secret_key_share.rs] [Function: TryFrom<&[u8]>] [Panic on invalid input] Can specially crafted input cause TryFrom to panic instead of returning an error, enabling DoS attacks on validators during DKG? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_secret_key_share.rs] [Function: to_bytes()] [Panic on serialization] Are there any edge cases (infinity point, specific values) where to_bytes() could panic, causing validator crashes during share export? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_secret_key_share.rs] [Struct: DealtSecretKeyShare] [Zero share attack] Can a zero-valued DealtSecretKeyShare be created (wrapping identity element) and used to nullify other players' contributions during reconstruction? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_secret_key_share.rs] [Function: new()] [Unchecked construction] Since new() doesn't validate its input, can it be used to create shares with invalid internal state that cause downstream protocol failures? (High)
